xcsf
Class EvolutionaryComp

java.lang.Object
  xcsf.EvolutionaryComp

 class EvolutionaryComp
extends java.lang.Object

This class encapsulates the evolutionary process of xcsf, i.e. selection, crossover, mutation and insertion/subsumption.

Author:
Patrick O. Stalph, Martin V. Butz

Method Detail

evolve

void evolve(Population population,
            MatchSet matchSet,
            StateDescriptor state,
            int iteration)
Starts the evolutionary process.

Parameters:
population - the current population.
matchSet - the matchset to evolve.
state - the state, this matchSet matched.
iteration - the current iteration.

setCondensation

void setCondensation(boolean value)
Sets the condensation flag.

Parameters:
value - The value to set.

selection

java.util.Vector<Classifier> selection(MatchSet matchSet,
                                       double fitnessSum)
Selection routine.

Parameters:
matchSet - the matchset to select from.
fitnessSum - the sum of fitnesses of the matchSet.
Returns:
the selected Classifier objects.

crossoverAndMutation

void crossoverAndMutation(java.util.Vector<Classifier> offspring)
Crossover and mutation routine.

Parameters:
offspring - the list of Classifier objects to cross and/or mutate.

insertion

void insertion(java.util.Vector<Classifier> offspring,
               java.util.Vector<Classifier> parents,
               MatchSet matchSet,
               Population population,
               StateDescriptor state)
Insertion routine.

Parameters:
offspring - the offspring to insert.
parents - the parents of the given offspring (same order!).
matchSet - the matchSet.
population - the population to insert into.
state - the machted state.
